quotes.quote: If having a soul means being able to feel love and loyalty and gratitude, then animals are better off than a lot of humans.
Until one has loved an animal, a part of one's soul remains unawakened.
Dogs are not our whole life, but they make our lives whole.
Grief is like the ocean; it comes on waves ebbing and flowing. Sometimes the water is calm, and sometimes it is overwhelming. All we can do is learn to swim.
love knows not its own depth until the hour of separation.
A pet is never truly forgotten until it is no longer remembered.
Nothing to be done really about animals. Anything you do looks foolish._ The answer isn't in us. It's almost as if were put here on earth to show how silly they aren't. _
There is no death. Only a change of worlds._
I was a dog in a past life. Really. I'll be walking down the street and dogs will do a sort of double take. Like, Hey, I know him.
Animals are reliable; many full of love, true in their affections, predictable in their actions, grateful, and loyal. Difficult standards for people to live up to.
We must embrace pain and burn it as fuel for our journey
His ears were often the first thing to catch my tears
Give sorrow words. The grief that does not speak whispers the o'er-fraught heart, and bids it break
The risk of love is loss, and the price of loss is grief. But the pain of grief is only a shadow when compared with the pain of never risking love.
If there are no dogs in Heaven, then when I die I want to go where they went.
Ask the beasts and they will teach you the beauty of this earth.

Dogs come into our lives to teach us about love, they depart to teach us about loss. A new dog never replaces an old dog, it merely expands the heart. If you have loved many dogs your heart is very big.
Agreeable friends - they ask no questions, they pass no criticisms.
I know God would never give me something that I could not handle. I just wish he didn't trust me so much.
Friendship is precious, not only in the shade, but in the sunshine of life.
With eye upraised his master's look to scan, The joy, the solace, and the aid of man: The rich man's guardian and the poor man's friend, The only creature faithful to the end.
Death ends a life, not a relationship.
God's finger touched him, and he slept.
Although the world is full of suffering, it is full also of the overcoming of it.
Our sweetest experiences of affection are meant to point us to that realm which is the real and endless home of the heart.
